Units.Unit_Name: Fundamental Principles About Different Aspects Of Microbiology Including
Topics: History and Evolution of Microbiology, Classification – Three kingdom, five kingdom, six kingdom and eight kingdom.
Microbial biodiversity: Introduction to microbial biodiversity- ecological niche.
Basic concepts of Eubacteria, Archaebacteria and Eucarya.

Units.Unit_Name: Describe The Structural Organization, Morphology And Reproduction
Topics: General characteristics of cellular microorganisms (Bacteria, Algae, Fungi and Protozoa) and acellular microorganisms - (Viruses, Viroids, Prions), Differences between prokaryotic and eukaryotic microorganisms.
Structure of Bacterial cell wall, cell membrane, capsule, flagella, pili, mesosomes, chlorosomes, phycobilisomes, spores, and gas vesicles.
Structure of fungi (Mold and Yeast), Structure of microalgae.

Units.Unit_Name: Methods Of Cultivation Of Microbes And Measurement
Topics: Bacterial culture media and pure culture techniques.
Mode of cell division, Quantitative measurement of growth.

Units.Unit_Name: Microscopy And Other Basic Laboratory Techniques – Culturing
Topics: Microscopy – Simple, bright field, dark field, phase contrast, fluorescent, electron microscope – TEM & SEM, Confocal microscopy, and Atomic Force Microscopy.

Units.Unit_Name: Compare And Contrast The Different Methods Of Sterilization

course_outcomes.1: Study the historical events that led to the discoveries and inventions and understand the Classification of Microorganisms.
course_outcomes.2: Gain Knowledge of detailed structure and functions of prokaryotic cell organelles.
course_outcomes.3: Understand the various microbiological techniques, different types of media, and techniques involved in culturing microorganisms.
course_outcomes.4: Explain the principles and working mechanism of different microscopes/Microscope, their function and scope of application.
course_outcomes.5: Understand the concept of asepsis and modes of sterilization and disinfectants.
